diseases.name: Algal Leaf Spot
diseases.introduction: A fungal-like disease forming dark greenish-black spots on Jackfruit leaves, reducing photosynthesis and weakening the plant.
symptoms: Small dark green spots on leaves.
Leaves may yellow and fall prematurely.
immediateActions: Avoid overhead irrigation to reduce moisture on leaves.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil to prevent fungal growth.
Use compost teas to enhance plant resistance.
chemicalControl: Apply copper-based fungicides weekly during humid conditions.
Use Mancozeb sprays as a preventive measure.
prevention: Maintain proper spacing between trees for airflow.
Regularly monitor leaves for early signs of infection.

diseases.name: Anthracnose
diseases.introduction: A common fungal disease causing black spots on leaves, flowers, and fruits, leading to reduced yield.
symptoms: Small black spots on leaves and fruit.
chemicalControl: Apply copper fungicides during flowering and early fruiting.
Use systemic fungicides like Difenoconazole if severe.
prevention: Avoid wetting flowers and fruits excessively.
Maintain tree health with proper fertilization.

diseases.name: Aphids
diseases.introduction: Sap-sucking insects that feed on cotton leaves, reducing plant vigor and transmitting viral diseases.
symptoms: Curling and yellowing of young leaves.
Sticky honeydew on leaves attracting sooty mold.
immediateActions: Spray water to knock off aphids.
Remove heavily infested leaves if possible.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil or garlic extract.
chemicalControl: Use insecticidal soaps or imidacloprid if infestation is high.
Avoid broad-spectrum insecticides that kill beneficial insects.
prevention: Monitor seedlings regularly for aphid presence.

diseases.name: Apple Scab
diseases.introduction: A fungal disease causing scabby spots on leaves and fruits, making apples cracked and deformed.
symptoms: Leaves turn yellow and drop early.
Fruit develops rough, scabby, dark spots.
immediateActions: Rake and destroy fallen leaves to reduce overwintering spores.
Prune trees to open canopy for sunlight and air.
naturalControl: Apply organic liquid copper soap sprays before symptoms appear.
Plant resistant varieties like Honeycrisp or Liberty.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides containing Captan or Myclobutanil early in season.
Spray Mancozeb protectively before rain events.
Use systemic fungicides during rapid leaf growth.
prevention: Water in the morning to allow leaves to dry.

diseases.name: Bacterial Blight
diseases.introduction: Also known as 'Black Arm', this bacterial disease attacks all parts of the cotton plant causing seedling blight and boll rot.
symptoms: Bolls rot and do not open properly.
immediateActions: Do not save seeds from infected plants.
naturalControl: Soak seeds in cow urine or hot water before sowing.
Spray neem oil to control insect vectors.
Use biocontrol agents like Pseudomonas fluorescens.
chemicalControl: Spray Copper Oxychloride mixed with Streptocycline.

diseases.name: Bacterial Canker
diseases.introduction: Bacterial infection causing sunken cankers on branches, stems, and fruits, reducing yield and tree vigor.
naturalControl: Apply neem oil to affected areas.
chemicalControl: Spray copper-based bactericides weekly during rainy season.
Use antibiotics like Streptocycline in extreme cases.

diseases.name: Bacterial Leaf Spot
diseases.introduction: Bacterial leaf spot causes dark, water-soaked lesions on leaves and fruit, reducing photosynthesis and quality.
symptoms: Small dark water-soaked spots on leaves.
naturalControl: Use compost tea to boost plant immunity.

diseases.name: Bacterial Spot
diseases.introduction: Bacterial spot causes dark, raised lesions on leaves and fruit, affecting photosynthesis and fruit quality.
symptoms: Small dark raised spots on leaves and fruits.

diseases.name: Bacterial Spot
diseases.introduction: Bacterial disease causing dark spots on leaves and fruits, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
immediateActions: Remove and destroy infected leaves and fruits.

diseases.name: Bacterial Spot
diseases.introduction: Bacterial disease causing dark lesions on leaves, stems, and fruits, affecting growth and yield.
symptoms: Dark water-soaked spots on leaves and fruits.

diseases.name: Bacterial Blights
diseases.introduction: Bacterial blights cause lesions on leaves and stems, reducing photosynthesis and yield.

diseases.name: Black Rot
diseases.introduction: A bacterial disease causing yellow V-shaped lesions on leaves that expand and rot the head.
symptoms: Yellow V-shaped lesions on leaf margins.
naturalControl: Rotate crops to reduce bacteria in soil.

diseases.name: Black Spot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing black spots on leaves and fruits, affecting photosynthesis and fruit quality.

diseases.name: Black Rot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease that affects leaves, fruits, and branches, causing fruit rot and leaf spotting.
naturalControl: Apply compost teas for soil health.

diseases.name: Black Rot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing black spots on leaves and berries, leading to fruit drop.
immediateActions: Prune and dispose of affected branches.

diseases.name: Brown Spot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease affecting rice leaves, causing brown spots and reduced photosynthesis.
symptoms: Leaves may dry and fall prematurely.

diseases.name: Cedar Apple Rust
diseases.introduction: A fungal disease affecting apples and cedars, forming orange pustules on leaves and fruit, reducing quality.
naturalControl: Remove nearby cedar hosts if possible.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides containing Mancozeb or Myclobutanil during early leaf development.
prevention: Maintain proper spacing for air circulation.
Avoid overhead irrigation during wet conditions.

diseases.name: Cercospora Leaf Spot / Gray Leaf Spot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing brown to gray lesions on leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
symptoms: Small brown or gray lesions on leaves.
Lesions may merge forming larger dead areas.
immediateActions: Avoid planting maize after maize (crop rotation).
naturalControl: Maintain healthy soil and crop rotation.
Use compost teas to improve leaf immunity.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides containing Azoxystrobin or Propiconazole when lesions first appear.
Use preventive copper sprays in humid conditions.

diseases.name: Common Rust
diseases.introduction: A fungal disease causing reddish-brown pustules on maize leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.
symptoms: Leaves may yellow and die prematurely.
immediateActions: Monitor fields weekly for early signs.
naturalControl: Encourage beneficial microbes to reduce stress.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides such as Propiconazole or Azoxystrobin at early infection stages.
prevention: Rotate crops to reduce fungal build-up.

diseases.name: Cutting Weevil
diseases.introduction: Insect pest that attacks young shoots and cuttings, causing wilting and dieback of mango branches.
immediateActions: Monitor new shoots for adult weevils.
naturalControl: Introduce parasitic wasps or predatory insects.
Spray neem oil to repel adults.
chemicalControl: Apply systemic insecticides to affected trees.
Use pyrethroid sprays for adult weevils.
prevention: Inspect grafts and cuttings before planting.

diseases.name: Die Back
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing drying and death of branches, especially at tips, affecting mango productivity.
symptoms: Brown or black lesions on branch tips.
Branches dry and die back gradually.
immediateActions: Prune affected branches and burn them.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil to reduce fungal spores.
chemicalControl: Use copper-based fungicides weekly during wet season.

diseases.name: Downy Mildew
diseases.introduction: Fungal-like disease causing yellow patches on upper leaf surfaces and grey mold underneath, reducing plant growth.
symptoms: Yellow or pale green patches on upper leaf surface.
Greyish mold on underside of leaves.

diseases.name: Early Blight
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing dark lesions on leaves and stems, reducing yield and tuber quality.
symptoms: Stem lesions and rotting of tubers.
chemicalControl: Apply systemic fungicides like Mancozeb or Chlorothalonil.
Use preventive sprays before disease onset.
prevention: Maintain proper irrigation to avoid leaf wetness.

diseases.name: Early Blight
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease affecting leaves, stems, and fruits, causing dark spots and reducing yield.
symptoms: Dark brown spots with concentric rings on leaves.
immediateActions: Remove infected leaves and prune stems.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil or biocontrol solutions.
chemicalControl: Spray preventive fungicides early in season.

diseases.name: Esca (Black Measles)
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing dark spots on berries and leaves, leading to fruit rot and vine weakening.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil on leaves and vines.
Improve soil health with organic matter.

diseases.name: Gall Midge
diseases.introduction: Insect pest attacking flower buds, leading to gall formation and poor fruit set.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil to deter adults.

diseases.name: Haunglongbing (Citrus greening)
diseases.introduction: Bacterial disease transmitted by psyllids, causing yellow shoots and bitter, misshapen fruits.
chemicalControl: Apply systemic antibiotics like streptomycin in early infection.
prevention: Avoid planting susceptible varieties near infected trees.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
naturalControl: Maintain regular watering and nutrient supply.
prevention: Regularly inspect plants and maintain hygiene.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
naturalControl: Maintain regular watering and nutrient supply.
prevention: Regularly inspect plants and maintain hygiene.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
prevention: Monitor plants regularly for early signs of disease.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
prevention: Regular monitoring and pruning as needed.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
prevention: Regular field inspection and pest monitoring.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: The plant is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
prevention: Regular monitoring for pests and diseases.

diseases.name: Healthy Leaf
diseases.introduction: The pumpkin plant leaf is healthy with no visible disease symptoms.
prevention: Regular inspection for pests and diseases.

diseases.name: Hispa
diseases.introduction: Insect pest that feeds on rice leaves, causing white streaks and reduced photosynthesis.
chemicalControl: Apply insecticides such as Imidacloprid or Chlorpyrifos.
prevention: Monitor fields regularly for pest presence.

diseases.name: Late Blight
diseases.introduction: A devastating fungal-like disease that affects potato leaves and tubers, causing dark lesions and rapid rot.
symptoms: White fungal growth on undersides of leaves.
Rotting of tubers in the soil.
naturalControl: Practice crop rotation with non-host crops.
Ensure good air circulation and spacing.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides containing Mancozeb, Chlorothalonil, or Metalaxyl.
Spray preventive fungicides regularly during wet conditions.
prevention: Avoid planting potatoes in wet, poorly drained fields.

diseases.name: Late Blight
diseases.introduction: Fungal-like disease causing leaf and fruit lesions, leading to severe crop losses in tomato plants.
symptoms: Dark brown or black spots on leaves.
naturalControl: Maintain proper plant spacing and airflow.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides like Mancozeb or Copper-based sprays.
Use systemic fungicides at first sign of disease.
prevention: Avoid planting tomatoes in damp areas.

diseases.name: Leaf Mold
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease that causes yellowing and moldy growth on tomato leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
symptoms: Fuzzy gray mold on undersides of leaves.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil or other organic antifungal solutions.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides containing Copper or Mancozeb.

diseases.name: Leaf Blight (Isariopsis Leaf Spot)
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing brown spots and leaf blight in grapevines, reducing yield and quality.
symptoms: Brown spots on leaves with yellow halos.
chemicalControl: Use fungicides like Mancozeb or Copper-based sprays.

diseases.name: Leaf Scorch
diseases.introduction: Bacterial disease causing leaf scorching and reduced plant growth.
naturalControl: Use drip irrigation to prevent leaf wetness.
chemicalControl: Spray preventive chemicals during humid weather.

diseases.name: Mosaic
diseases.introduction: Viral disease causing mottled leaf patterns and reduced growth in sugarcane.
symptoms: Light and dark green mosaic patterns on leaves.
naturalControl: Encourage natural predators of insect vectors.
chemicalControl: Control insect vectors using systemic insecticides.

diseases.name: Mosaic Disease
diseases.introduction: Viral disease causing mottled leaves and stunted growth in pumpkin plants.
symptoms: Light and dark green patches on leaves.
naturalControl: Encourage natural enemies of aphid vectors.

diseases.name: Northern Leaf Blight
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing elongated gray-green lesions on maize leaves, reducing yield.
chemicalControl: Use fungicides like Mancozeb or Azoxystrobin during early infection.
prevention: Rotate crops and avoid continuous maize planting.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease producing white powdery growth on leaves and stems, reducing photosynthesis.
chemicalControl: Spray preventive fungicides in humid conditions.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing white powdery spots on leaves and young shoots, reducing growth and fruit yield.
symptoms: White powder on leaves and shoots.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease producing white powdery growth on pumpkin leaves, affecting photosynthesis.

diseases.name: Powdery Mildew
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing white powdery spots on cherry leaves and shoots, reducing photosynthesis and growth.

diseases.name: Red Rot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing red discoloration in sugarcane stalks and internal rot.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides on soil and foliage if recommended.
Use systemic fungicides in severe cases.

diseases.name: Rust
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing orange pustules on sugarcane leaves, reducing photosynthesis.
symptoms: Orange or rust-colored pustules on leaves.
naturalControl: Encourage natural predators of rust spores.
chemicalControl: Apply fungicides like Mancozeb or Propiconazole preventively.

diseases.name: Septoria Leaf Spot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing small dark spots with light centers on tomato leaves, leading to defoliation.
symptoms: Small brown or black spots on leaves.

diseases.name: Sooty Mould
diseases.introduction: Fungal growth on leaf surface forming black sooty coating, usually secondary to insect honeydew.
symptoms: Black powdery coating on leaves and stems.
naturalControl: Spray neem oil to reduce insect activity.
chemicalControl: Spray insecticides to control honeydew-producing pests.

diseases.name: Spider Mites (Two-spotted)
diseases.introduction: Insect pest causing tiny yellow or white spots on leaves and webbing, reducing photosynthesis.
symptoms: Yellow or white speckles on leaves.
chemicalControl: Apply miticides such as Abamectin or Spiromesifen.
prevention: Monitor plants regularly for spider mites.
Maintain humidity to reduce mite outbreaks.

diseases.name: Target Spot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing round brown spots with concentric rings on tomato leaves and fruits.
symptoms: Round brown lesions with light center.

diseases.name: Target Spot
diseases.introduction: Fungal disease causing small circular lesions on cotton leaves, reducing photosynthesis and yield.

diseases.name: Tomato Yellow Leaf Curl Virus
diseases.introduction: Viral disease transmitted by whiteflies causing leaf curling, yellowing, and reduced fruit yield.

diseases.name: Tomato Mosaic Virus
diseases.introduction: Viral disease causing mosaic patterns on leaves, stunted growth, and reduced fruit yield in tomato.
symptoms: Mosaic pattern of light and dark green on leaves.
chemicalControl: No chemical cure for the virus.
prevention: Maintain strict hygiene in greenhouse or field.

diseases.name: Unknown Disease
diseases.introduction: The disease affecting this crop is not identified or classified.
symptoms: Plant shows unusual signs or stress.
immediateActions: Isolate the plant to prevent spread.
prevention: Quarantine new plants before introducing them.
Keep detailed records of plant health.

diseases.name: Yellow
diseases.introduction: Sugarcane showing yellow coloration, but considered healthy.
symptoms: Leaves appear yellowish due to natural variation or minor stress.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Apple plants with no visible disease symptoms.
prevention: Monitor regularly for early signs of disease.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Blueberry plants with no signs of disease or pest infestation.
symptoms: Leaves, stems, and fruits are healthy and normal.
naturalControl: Ensure good soil moisture and nutrients.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Cherry plants with no visible signs of disease or pests.
symptoms: Leaves are green and free of spots.
prevention: Monitor regularly for early signs of problems.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Corn plants showing normal growth with no disease.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Grapevines with no disease symptoms.
prevention: Monitor regularly for early signs of stress.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Peach plants without disease or pest issues.
symptoms: Leaves, flowers, and fruits are healthy.
prevention: Monitor for early pest and disease symptoms.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Bell pepper plants with no signs of disease.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Potato plants showing normal growth and development.
naturalControl: Ensure proper irrigation and soil nutrition.
prevention: Monitor plants regularly for early issues.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Raspberry plants with no visible disease symptoms.
symptoms: Leaves, stems, and fruits appear healthy.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Soybean plants with normal growth and no disease.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Strawberry plants with no disease or pest issues.

diseases.name: Healthy
diseases.introduction: Tomato plants showing normal growth and no visible disease.
symptoms: Leaves, stems, and fruits are healthy.
naturalControl: Ensure proper nutrient and water supply.
